data.question: What is the name of the ultra-stable fluorinated hybrid porous material synthesized for acetylene storage and separation?
What unique structure does SIFSIX-Cu-TPA possess?
What is the BET surface area of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA?
What is the C2H2 uptake of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA at 298 K and 1 bar?
How long did the synthesis of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA crystals take?
What is the breakthrough time for C2H2/CO2 separation using SIFSIX-Cu-TPA at 298 K and 1 bar?
What is the role of SiF6 2- anions in the structure of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA?
data.answer: They cross-link two adjacent metal nodes as pillars to stabilize the three-dimensional framework.

data.question: Why is SIFSIX-Cu-TPA considered ultra-stable?
data.answer: Because of its ultra-high water and thermal stability.

data.question: Why does SIFSIX-Cu-TPA exhibit excellent C2H2/CO2 separation performance?
data.answer: Due to the obvious difference in the adsorption performance of CO2 and C2H2, especially in the low pressure area.

data.question: What is the significance of the ith-d topology in SIFSIX-Cu-TPA?
data.answer: It provides a unique pillar-cage structure that enhances gas adsorption and separation capabilities.

data.question: How does the structure of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA differ from classical fluorinated materials?
data.answer: SIFSIX-Cu-TPA has a pillar-cage structure, unlike the pillar-layer structure of classical fluorinated materials.

data.question: What makes SIFSIX-Cu-TPA a promising material for gas separation?
data.answer: Its high adsorption capacity and excellent separation performance.

data.question: Is the BET surface area of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA higher than that of most ultra-microporous fluorinated MOFs?
Does SIFSIX-Cu-TPA have a lower C2H2 uptake at 298 K and 1 bar compared to other renowned MOFs?
Is the synthesis of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA conducted at high temperatures?
Can SIFSIX-Cu-TPA maintain its structure in common solvents like CH3CN and DMF?
Is the C2H2/CO2 separation performance of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA inferior to most famous reported robust MOFs?
Does SIFSIX-Cu-TPA exhibit a decrease in C2H2 uptakes after multiple cycles of acetylene adsorption?
Is the C2H2 uptake of SIFSIX-Cu-TPA at 0.1 bar and 298 K significantly lower than its CO2 uptake?
Does SIFSIX-Cu-TPA lose its crystallinity after exposure to air for over 6 months?
